name: Priyanka Goswami
biography: Priyanka Goswami is an Indian racewalker who specializes in the 20 km event. She holds the national record in the women's 20km race walk event. Goswami made history by becoming the first Indian woman to win a medal in the 20km race walk event at the World Athletics Championships in 2022, where she clinched the silver medal.
childhood: Priyanka Goswami was born on 31 December 1996 in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh. She took up athletics at a young age and initially competed in sprinting events before transitioning to race walking.
professional_career: Goswami's professional career has seen significant achievements. In 2021, she set a new national record in the women's 20km race walk event with a time of 1:28:45. At the 2022 World Athletics Championships in Eugene, Oregon, Goswami made history by becoming the first Indian woman to win a medal in the 20km race walk event, clinching the silver medal with a time of 1:28:18. This achievement qualified her for the 2024 Paris Olympics. Goswami has also won gold medals at the 2022 Commonwealth Games and the 2022 Asian Games in the 10,000m race walk event.
